metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7967 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
KMail since version 5.3.0 used a QWebEngine based viewer that had JavaScript enabled. Since the generated html is executed in the local file security context by default access to remote and local URLs was enabled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

akonadiconsole - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
akregator - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
blogilo - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 5.3.0 and over sbeattie> kmail did not use QWebSettings through zesty

criterions.comment: kdepim package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1').
